primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God overcomes the human inability to believe in unconditional grace by demonstrating His infinite capacity and willingness to help.

tekstueel_bewijs: I will strengthen thee; yea, I will help thee
God can help us without lessening his own resources
God gave his Son our souls to save

object.identificatie: The restoration and upholding of the believer (Assurance/Salvation)
tekstueel_bewijs: uphold thee with the right hand of my righteousness
But because the Lord loved you
does this represent the mind of the Eternal?
help you, my brother and my sister
delivered him up for us all
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver who is initially skeptical but eventually comforted.

tekstueel_bewijs: I have Jesus Christ as proof that God is willing
The same God who directs the earth in its orbit
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, but Christ functions as the ultimate Helper/Proof of the Subject's intent.

tegenstander.identificatie: Human Logic / The 'Fair Exchange' Principle / Doubt
tekstueel_bewijs: our souls, which are doubting God's promise
everything can be grasped by the mind
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The primary obstacle is not sin or the devil, but the human inability to process 'unreasonable' grace through logic.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human attempt to find a logical reason for God's grace.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer/Preacher
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (human reasoning) fails and must be superseded by the primary program (God's action).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God's Love → Upholding/Grace → The Doubting Hearer
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Jesus Christ → God ← Human Logic/Fair Exchange

voorbeelden_mens_subject: We sense that we are not worthy
we do not help because we might not have enough

voorbeelden: the Lord ought to bless us (framed as a question of merit)
God's love for us seems too good to be true
Hast thou not known? Hast thou not heard?
God can help us and not run short

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Ability' (Pouvoir) and 'Willingness' (Vouloir) to act, rather than the hearer's 'Obligation' (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Logic) to ~S1 (Doubt) and finally to S1 (Grace) via the realization that S1 is ~S2 (Unreasonable).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Grace is resolved not by logic, but by the infinite capacity of the Giver.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 (Fair Exchange) is presented as a strong human instinct that makes Grace difficult to receive.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the subject of almost all transformative verbs. The human role is reduced to the 'Receiver' who must abandon logic to accept a gift.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Did he overestimate our determination to reach fulfillment?

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: I will strengthen thee; yea, I will help thee
The Lord did not set his love upon you... because ye were more in number... But because the Lord loved you.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Moses, Israel) are used to show human unworthiness and God's sovereign choice rather than as models to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: Israel was chosen despite their lack of merit.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; shifting from self-reliance to God-reliance.

narratieve_hierarchie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon stays strictly within the Fundamental Program (Soteriology).
spanning_punten: The tension between human 'fair exchange' logic and divine 'unconditional' love.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He that spared not his own Son, but delivered him up for us all

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on God's external power (Pouvoir) rather than the Spirit's internal work.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Moderate; sin is seen as 'faults' and 'unworthiness' that make grace seem illogical.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: A masterclass in theocentric preaching where God is the sole Subject of the promise and the performance.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance as it serves the theme of assurance.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Could add a touch of 'Savoir' regarding how the believer lives in response.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Briefly mention that the 'Opponent' is also the 'Accuser' (Satan) who uses logic to condemn.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To show that God's 'Pouvoir' overcomes not just doubt, but actual spiritual opposition.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon perfectly exemplifies the 'Grammar of Grace' by keeping God as the active Subject and the human as the blessed Receiver.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'boss' anecdote; Greimassian analysis shows the anecdote serves to define the 'Opponent' (Fair Exchange logic).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the context of Isaiah; this analysis focuses on the functional roles assigned to God and the congregation in the present moment.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from a 'Subject-Switch' where the hearer's inability (lack of Pouvoir) is replaced by God's infinite capacity.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses a 'Via Negativa' approach to logic to clear the way for a 'Via Positiva' of Grace.
